body:
Comment 12 by **xianrenb**: 
I think that I got the wrong meaning of "closely-related basis".
As in go version 1.0.3, most of the codes inside the standard library have very few
blank lines. I previously thought that means no blank line is used in the functions
inside the standard library.
I see the difficulty now.
However, I believe one may add a comment (or even a blank comment) for a meaningful
closely-related code block for automated formatting. It is possible to improve "gofmt"
as a better automated tool while allowing one to group closely-related code.
Of course it would lose some minor, hidden information (of what are closely-related) if
we run the new "gofmt" for all the codes inside the standard library, but most go
programmers would be happy to have a tool that could format their code automatically.
There are certainly some people like me, only group closely related code by using
comments, think that blank lines are used only for better appearance and use styles
similar to me. The bottom line is that code written by different go programmers would
probably be in different styles without a new "gofmt".
